original_title: Bronx: Stephens Avenue - Bronx River Avenue
text:
(1)
Stephens Avenue, at the N. W. corner of Bronx River Avenue, showing the Clasons Point Inn. Part of this building is from the original Cornell house, built in 1643 and later burned by the Indians. At the time of this writing (1937) the house is in a semi-abandoned state and is used as a residence by indigent people.

1906

Gift of Randall Comfort

(2)
A view of the old inn from the opposite direction, years later. It was, at one time, part of Clasons Point Amusement Park.

August 5, 1935

P. L. Sperr

original_title: Bronx: Stephens Avenue - Bronx River Avenue
text:
(1)
Stephens Avenue, at the N. W. corner of Bronx River Avenue, showing the Clasons Point Inn. Part of this building is from the original Cornell house, built in 1643 and later burned by the Indians. At the time of this writing (1937) the house is in a semi-abandoned state and is used as a residence by indigent people.

1906

Gift of Randall Comfort

(2)
A view of the old inn from the opposite direction, years later. It was, at one time, part of Clasons Point Amusement Park.

August 5, 1935

P. L. Sperr

Clasons Point Amusement Park (Bronx): The dancing palace, which stood at the N.W. corner of Cornell and Newman Avenues. The park, which was later abandoned, was on the west side of Soundview Avenue, near the East River.

July 29, 1928
Views 1, 2, 3

P. L. Sperr

Clasons Point Amusement Park (Bronx): The dancing palace, which stood at the N.W. corner of Cornell and Newman Avenues. The park, which was later abandoned, was on the west side of Soundview Avenue, near the East River.

July 29, 1928
Views 1, 2, 3

P. L. Sperr

original_title: Bronx: Stephens Avenue - Bronx River Avenue
text:
Stephens Avenue, at the N. W. corner of Bronx River Avenue, showing the Clason Point Inn, dating back to pre-Revolutionary days. Part of the inn is from the original Cornel house built in 1643 and later burned by the Indians; it is within the Clason Point Amusement Park. When the amusement park was abandoned the building was taken over by indigent people for residential purposes.

July 29, 1928
Views 1,2,3

P. L. Sperr

F2 - NEG# 3255
